paper_metadata.title: Impact of social safety net programs on agricultural performance of households in Mali

program_information.program_name: JigisemeJiri (Tree of Hope) and Common Framework on Seasonal Social Safety Nets (CCFS)
program_information.target_population: Chronically poor households and poor households affected by food and politico-military crises

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: The latter involves regular cash or in-kind transfers from governmental and nongovernmental entities to individuals or households.

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The latter involves regular cash or in-kind transfers from governmental and nongovernmental entities to individuals or households.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Agricultural performance, measured as the logarithm of the value of production per hectare, is the dependent variable.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The endogenous switching regression (ESR) model is applied to data from 2284 households drawn from Mali's 2014 Living Standards Measurement Survey (LSMS).

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The government of Mali, following the country's socio-economic instability and its negative impact on food security and household poverty, initiated a social safety net program dubbed 'JigisemeJiri' (tree of hope) in 2013 with support from the World Bank. | In April 2014, the 'Common Framework on Seasonal Social Safety Nets (CCFS)' was launched
evidence_citations.country_citation: The government of Mali, following the country's socio-economic instability and its negative impact on food security and household poverty, initiated a social safety net program
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: This program provides regular support to chronically poor households | The objective of CCFS was to lay the foundations for the resilience of more than 40,000 poor households hardest hit by the food and politico-military crises.
